resources.string: Corona viruses are a large family of viruses which may cause illness in animals or humans. In humans, several coronaviruses are known to cause respiratory infections ranging from the common cold to more severe diseases such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS). The most recently discovered corona virus causes corona virus disease COVID-19.

You can help patients with a severe condition of COVID by donating antibodies in your blood. If you have recovered from COVID-19, you can help other patients by donating your blood. The antibodies developed in your blood will help fight the virus in other patient\'s bodies.
Here is some advice from the experts about the right time to get tested for COVID-19
Social distancing in a market place during COVID-19 in English and Hindi
Let\'s see what experts have to say about staying indoors and healthy practices.
Your data is saved in a secure environment \nthat will be reached by hospital and analysis staff on a need to know basis.
Â© 2020 IIIT-D initiative.\nThis app is for a non-profit purpose, refrain from misusing.

We are making a non-profit attempt of saving lives by making a pool of contact numbers to facilitate availability for blood/antibody donation for hospitals. You will be contacted by relevant hospitals. If you do not want to provide your own mobile number, it is OK. You can provide the mobile number of your friend/guardian who can inform you. However, for blood transfusion, you will have to visit the hospital yourself.

Kindly do not entertain phone calls on this issue from any individual until it comes from a hospital. For your safety, try using your own transportation system to go to the hospital which contacted you for blood.

We are making a non-profit attempt of saving lives by making a pool of contact numbers to facilitate availability for blood/antibody donation for hospitals. We will send relevant contact information to your hospital. Kindly give your contact number and your hospitals contact info (email id is optional). We do not need your personal details.
You may want to post your need for blood plasma on our dashboard, and maybe you get some help. However, always meet or call the potential donor only in a hospital, as he could be having an infection.

You can post about your need for blood plasma here. This will let others know about your need and extend a helping hand. You can also see posts by other people below the form. But do not rely entirely on posting your advertisement here. You should also try your best to connect to different hospitals which have treated corona patients.
You can search for posts country-wise. Please refer to the Country form field above for naming conventions (e.g. instead of US, use United States).

The idea of using plasma from survivors, also known as convalescent-plasma therapy, dates back to the late 19th century. Doctors have transfused the blood of recovered patients into those still sick with the 1918 flu, measles, polio, chickenpox, SARS, and Ebola to varying degrees of success. Given the dearth of treatments for COVID-19, convalescent plasma has gained new prominence. The blood of survivors, the thinking goes, contains proteins called antibodies that can neutralize the corona virus.
Let\'s see what the experts and people who have undergone blood transfusion have to say.
Mayo Clinic CEO says convalescent plasma could be an effective treatment for corona virus.
Our Team is From IIIT Delhi
Our initiative is a non-profit effort to connect donor and needy via hospitals. We are currently focusing on COVID pandemic.
For any query you can contact us at: contact.reach2patient@gmail.com
Information and Consent Letter for Collecting your Contact Information

Even though we are not a profit-making financial institution, but we are following the Telephone Consumer Protection protocol and require consent before contacting volunteers and members on their phones. We do not do blood transfusion for you but we are just providing IT support to help hospitals to get contact of volunteers. We are also trying to provide an opportunity for patients to connect to hospitals for blood transfusion. Ifyou give your phone number and you have volunteered to donate blood for the treatment of patients, we will provide your phone number to hospital. Hence you will get a call from the hospital. If you have given your phone number for receiving blood, you will get a call from hospitals who have the facility for blood transfusion

To maintain your privacy, we are not asking any other detail from you. We just ask your contact phone number and age. By acknowledging and accepting this consent letter, we have permission to contact you regarding asking your willingness to donate blood plasma. You also give us permission to share your phone number with hospitals who need your blood plasma for treating severe cases. By accepting this consent letter, you also give permission to hospitals to contact you regarding your willingness and time for blood donation for COVID patients

Giving your contact number does not mean that you are obliged to donate blood plasma, but it just creates the opportunity to contact you. You may later refuse to donate blood if it is inconvenient to you.

Overall your consent allows us and hospitals treating patients to use text messaging, artificial or pre-recorded voice message and automatic dialling technology for informational calls but not for telemarketing or sales calls.
It is an online acceptance by pressing a button.
To be able to receive phone numbers of volunteers from reach2patient.com for the purpose of blood transfusion in order to handle severe cases of COVID-19 infection:

1. Only if you represent a hospital capable of performing safe blood transfusion, you will receive the phone number of individuals who have volunteered to donate blood for treating patients. You have to follow guide-lines provided by respective authorities such as advisories provided by Indian National Blood transfusion Council https://www.mohfw.gov.in/pdf/NBTCGUIDANCEFORCOVID19.pdf, by European commission https://ec.europa.eu/health/blood_tissues_organs/covid-19_en and FDA.

2. You will not share the phone provided by us to any third party. You and your organisation will not contact or call the phone number provided by us for sales of services and product or advertisement. You will only use the phone numbers for asking the willingness of volunteers and making arrangement for blood transfusion between patient and volunteer.

3. After 4 months of receiving the phone number of volunteers, you will delete those phone numbers to avoid any misuse. In case of any misuse of phone numbers is found or reported, your organisation will listed in blacklist, and it will not receive and support from us.
4. You will not follow the volunteers to the point that they feel harassed by you or your organisation. Any complaint from volunteers will again hint us to stop support for you.

5. If a volunteer ask us to delete his number from our list, we will inform you and your organisationand wewill also delete his respective contact information from our database. It is to make sure that the volunteers do not feel harassed and chased. Once asked, your organisation should also delete those contact numbers from your database.
